column4: how does on install the PAE kernel module on an ubuntu feisty server?
will my ubuntu machine use > 4 G ram if i don't have the pae kernel module instaled?
the -server kernel does not have restricted drivers.
sorry, so if it doesn't have the restricted drivers, does that mean i can't use the ram > 4 G?
it does, but it means that you probably can't use your ati/nvidia/wifi properly.
well it is a server, so i don't need any of that
the server install CD installs the -server kernel by default.
does that mean the server kernel will use all my ram >4 G?
but 'top' and 'free' only show less than 4G ram
are you running the server kernel? does your processor support PAE?
supports PAE, yes, I believe so, intel clovertown cpus, but PAE module isn't installed
Well, thats the problem. You are running the -386 kernel, not the -server kernel
shoot.  well thanks a lot for your help!   much appreciated!
